pages.title: Change in the supply curve for milk

elements.name: panel1
elements.title: For the following examples, decide how the supply curve for milk will change. Also describe what effects this has on the price in the short term (including a brief explanation). What is the reason behind the respective shift in the supply curve?

elements.name: question4
elements.title: Example: Due to a severe drought in Switzerland, farmers are unable to produce as much feed for their dairy cows for the winter as planned and have to import expensive feed from abroad.

elements.name: Allfällige Korrektur
elements.title: Effects on the price including brief justification
elements.correctAnswer: Rising - demand unchanged with lower supply

elements.name: question14
elements.title: Reason for the shift in the supply curve
elements.correctAnswer: Change in price for advance services

pages.title: Change in the supply curve for milk

elements.name: panel2
elements.title: For the following examples, decide how the supply curve for milk will change. Also describe what effects this has on the price in the short term (including a brief explanation). What is the reason behind the respective shift in the supply curve?

elements.name: question1
elements.title: Example: A major buyer of milk for cheese production decides to only offer vegan products in future and no longer purchase milk.

elements.name: question2
elements.title: Effects on the price including brief justification
elements.correctAnswer: Declines - because the demand curve shifts to the left with the same supply, there is a shift on the supply curve

elements.name: question3
elements.title: Reason for the shift in the supply curve

pages.name: page2
pages.title: Change in the supply curve for milk

elements.name: panel3
elements.title: For the following examples, decide how the supply curve for milk will change. Also describe what effects this has on the price in the short term (including a brief explanation). What is the reason behind the respective shift in the supply curve?

elements.name: question5
elements.title: Example: The federal government decides to cut farmers' subsidies for milk production. In future, farms will receive less money from the federal government.

elements.name: question6
elements.title: Effects on the price including brief justification
elements.correctAnswer: Rising - demand unchanged with lower supply

elements.name: question7
elements.title: Reason for the shift in the supply curve
elements.correctAnswer: Change in price for intermediate consumption (indirect).
